definition[0]: to push someone gently, usually with your elbow, in order to get their attention
example[0]: Jill nudged him in the ribs.
definition[1]: to move something or someone a short distance by gently pushing
example[1]: She nudged the glass towards me.
example[2]: David nudged me out of the way.
definition[2]: to move forward slowly by pushing gently
example[3]: I started to nudge my way to the front of the crowd.
definition[3]: to gently persuade or encourage someone to take a particular decision or action
example[4]: Weâ€™re trying to nudge them towards a practical solution.
definition[4]: to almost reach a particular level or amount
example[5]: Outside the temperature was nudging 30 degrees Celsius.
definition[5]: to increase the value or position of something on a scale by a small amount, or to increase or move up by a small amount
example[6]: Investors bought blue chips again, nudging the Dow Jones Industrial Average to another all-time high.
example[7]: Honda increased its share of the car market even though its sales nudged up only slightly.
